wikipedia_page.main:
Charles Wenman (born 1797) was an English cricketer who played for Kent. He was born in Benenden.
Wenman made a single first-class appearance, in 1828, against Sussex. Playing as a middle-order batsman, in the same team as his brother, Ned, and his cousin George, he scored three runs in the only innings in which he batted.

response: |A leading wicket=keeper and all-rounder who played in 146 first-class matches, 61 of them for Kent. Brother of Charles Wenman and cousin of George and John Wenman.
